body_html:
Hi @zhanghang1989,

This is caused by the cuda library not recognizing your driver (see here). I think this is most likely due to the fact that the driver you are using does not support your OSX version. On Nvidia's website it says it only supports OSX 10.12.x
body_text:
Hi @zhanghang1989,
This is caused by the cuda library not recognizing your driver (see here). I think this is most likely due to the fact that the driver you are using does not support your OSX version. On Nvidia's website it says it only supports OSX 10.12.x
body:
Hi @zhanghang1989,

This is caused by the cuda library not recognizing your driver (see [here](https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/blob/cc3058bdac925dc20ba18b5829f689a67227f753/torch/csrc/cuda/Module.cpp#L167)). I think this is most likely due to the fact that the driver you are using does not support your OSX version. On [Nvidia's website](http://www.nvidia.com/object/macosx-cuda-9.0.197-driver.html) it says it only supports `OSX 10.12.x`
